pacman.network

Class SimpleP2PServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • pacman.network.SimpleP2PServer

  • public class SimpleP2PServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a simple P2P server that connects with other instances of servers. The class uses TCP for connection and send string messages.
    Version:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SimpleP2PServer.Tags
      Contains the tags for network messages.

      Contains the status of the local server.

      Contains the maximum number of client in this server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleP2PServer

        public SimpleP2PServer(NetworkController controller)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.SecurityException
        Constructor that establishes the server by checking an available port automatically.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller of this application
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkListen method doesn't allow the operation.

                       int maxClientNum)

        maxClientNum - the maximum number of clients

      • getLocalIP

        public static java.lang.String getLocalIP()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        This function returns the local ip address of the host machine.
        Returns:
        the ip address of the host machine
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during the connection

      • getLocalPort

        public int getLocalPort()
        This method checks the port of the local host.
        Returns:
        the local port of the host

      • getSystemIPConfig

        public static java.lang.String getSystemIPConfig()
        Returns the system command that shows the ip address. Usually ipconfig on windows and ifconfig on nix.
        Returns:
        the system command result

      • setMaxConnections

        public void setMaxConnections(int maxConnections)
        This method changes the number of maximum allowed connections. If there is already more connections, those connections won't be closed, but no more connections are allowed.
        Parameters:
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.SecurityException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method reestablishes the server by using a system allocated port number.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkListen method doesn't allow the operation.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port parameter is outside the specified range of valid port values, which is between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

      • startListening

        public void startListening(int port)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.SecurityException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method reestablishes the server by using a user specified port number.
        Parameters:
        port - the new port number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkListen method doesn't allow the operation.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port parameter is outside the specified range of valid port values, which is between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

      • restartListening

        public void restartListening()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.SecurityException
        This method let the server start listening for incoming connections.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkListen method doesn't allow the operation.

      • isListening

        public boolean isListening()
        This method gets the status of the local server.
        Returns:
        true if local server is listening to connections and false otherwise

      • listen

        public void listen()
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException
        This method let the server blocks and listens to an incoming connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when waiting for a connection.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkAccept method doesn't allow the operation.

      • closeServer

        public void closeServer()
        Closes the server.

      • confirmConnection

        public void confirmConnection(java.net.SocketAddress remoteSocketAddress)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Sends back the confirmation of connection.
        Parameters:
        remoteSocketAddress - the address of the remote side
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the output stream or if the socket is not connected.

      • getClientList

        public java.util.Set<java.net.SocketAddress> getClientList()
        This method gets the list of connected clients.
        Returns:
        a set containing the addresses of all connected clients

      • hasConnection

        public boolean hasConnection()
        This function checks if there is another host connected to this server.
        Returns:
        true if another host is connecting and false otherwise.

      • connectTo

        public java.net.SocketAddress connectTo(java.lang.String address,
                                        int port)
                                 throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.SecurityException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This function let the server connect to a remote host on its own initiative.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the remote host
        port - the port of the remote host
        Returns:
        the address of the remote side
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the IP address of the host could not be determined.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkConnect method doesn't allow the operation.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port parameter is outside the specified range of valid port values, which is between 0 and 65535, inclusive. or if the address is same as the address of the local host

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection(java.net.SocketAddress remoteSocketAddress)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method closes the connection between local host and remote host.
        Parameters:
        remoteSocketAddress - the address of the remote side
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when closing this socket.

      • closeAllConnection

        public void closeAllConnection()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method closes all connections between local host and remote hosts.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when closing this socket.

      • remoteCloseConnection

        public void remoteCloseConnection(java.net.Socket client)
        This method gets called when the remote side closes the connection.
        Parameters:
        client - the socket representing the remote side

      • acceptMessage

        public void acceptMessage(java.net.Socket client)
        This method continue receives messages from the remote side.
        Parameters:
        client - the socket connecting the server and a specified client

      • send

        public void send(java.net.SocketAddress target,
                 java.lang.String... message)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends a message to a specified remote host.
        Parameters:
        target - the target to receive this message
        message - the message that is about to be sent. Multiple parts of the message will be joined by a comma
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the output stream or if the socket is not connected.

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(java.lang.String... message)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends a message to every remote host.
        Parameters:
        message - the message that is about to be sent. Multiple parts of the message will be joined by a comma
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the output stream or if the socket is not connected.
